what: Receiver Operating Characteristic for Power Lindley Distribution
title: Receiver Operating Characteristic for Power Lindley Distribution
text: goal PLindleyROC evaluate Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) Power Lindley Distribution. Additionally, performace asssesments can performed associated Bi-Power Lindley ROC model.

title: Receiver Operating Characteristic for Power Lindley Distribution
text: can install development version PLindleyROC via following code:

title: Receiver Operating Characteristic for Power Lindley Distribution
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(PLindleyROC) dPLD(c(1,2,3,4,5,200),alpha=3,beta=2) #> [1]  1.082682e+00  1.620507e-05  3.560890e-21  1.070039e-52 3.363180e-105 #> [6]  0.000000e+00 library(PLindleyROC) pPLD(c(.5,1,2,3,4),alpha=3,beta=2) #> [1] 0.1562992 0.7744412 0.9999993 1.0000000 1.0000000 library(PLindleyROC) qPLD(c(.9971,0.5,0.3),alpha=3,beta=2) #> [1] 1.5220612 0.7868721 0.6362570 library(PLindleyROC) rPLD(10,alpha=3,beta=2) #>  [1] 0.2326157 0.7487430 0.7108872 1.0265832 1.1093256 1.0129171 0.8154424 #>  [8] 1.1566752 0.7763172 0.5504125 library(PLindleyROC) plAUC(alpha1=2,beta1=5,alpha2=6,beta2=1) #> [1] 0.9688111 library(PLindleyROC) plJ(alpha1=2,beta1=5,alpha2=6,beta2=1,init=0) #> $par #> [1] 0.7345928 #>  #> $value #> [1] -0.8241212 #>  #> $counts #> function gradient  #>       16       16  #>  #> $convergence #> [1] 0 #>  #> $message #> [1] "CONVERGENCE: REL_REDUCTION_OF_F <= FACTR*EPSMCH" library(PLindleyROC) plER(alpha1=2,beta1=5,alpha2=6,beta2=1,init=0) #> $par #> [1] 0.7430008 #>  #> $value #> [1] 0.1247003 #>  #> $counts #> function gradient  #>       11       11  #>  #> $convergence #> [1] 0 #>  #> $message #> [1] "CONVERGENCE: REL_REDUCTION_OF_F <= FACTR*EPSMCH" library(PLindleyROC) plCZ(alpha1=2,beta1=5,alpha2=6,beta2=1,init=0) #> $par #> [1] 0.736217 #>  #> $value #> [1] -0.831771 #>  #> $counts #> function gradient  #>       17       17  #>  #> $convergence #> [1] 0 #>  #> $message #> [1] "CONVERGENCE: REL_REDUCTION_OF_F <= FACTR*EPSMCH" library(PLindleyROC) plIU(alpha1=2,beta1=5,alpha2=6,beta2=1,init=0) #> $par #> [1] 0.7345927 #>  #> $value #> [1] 0.113501 #>  #> $counts #> function gradient  #>       12       12  #>  #> $convergence #> [1] 0 #>  #> $message #> [1] "CONVERGENCE: REL_REDUCTION_OF_F <= FACTR*EPSMCH" library(PLindleyROC) plNI(alpha1=2,beta1=5,alpha2=6,beta2=1,init=0.5) #> $par #> [1] 0.7873601 #>  #> $value #> [1] -0.01326588 #>  #> $counts #> function gradient  #>        6        6  #>  #> $convergence #> [1] 0 #>  #> $message #> [1] "CONVERGENCE: REL_REDUCTION_OF_F <= FACTR*EPSMCH" library(PLindleyROC) x=c(1,2,3,4) y=c(2,3,4) plROC(x,y,alpha1=2,beta1=5,alpha2=6,beta2=1,empirical=FALSE) library(PLindleyROC) prfROC(ctp=0.5,alpha1=2,beta1=5,alpha2=6,beta2=1) #>  Sensitivitiy   Specificity 1-Specificity  #>     0.9921878     0.6538067     0.3461933

title: Receiver Operating Characteristic for Power Lindley Distribution

title: Receiver Operating Characteristic for Power Lindley Distribution
text: Attwood, K., Hou, S., Hutson, ., 2022, Application skew exponential power distribution ROC curves, Journal Applied Statistics, 1-16. Ghitany M., Al-Mutairi D. K., Balakrishnan N., Al-Enezi L., 2013, Power lindley distribution associated inference, Computational Statistics & Data Analysis, 64,20–33. Liu, X., 2012, Classification accuracy cut point selection, Statistics medicine, 31(23), 2676-2686. Nahm, F. S., 2022, Receiver operating characteristic curve: overview practical use clinicians, Korean journal anesthesiology, 75(1), 25-36. Perkins, N. J., Schisterman, E. F., 2006, inconsistency “optimal” cutpoints obtained using two criteria based receiver operating characteristic curve, American journal epidemiology, 163(7), 670-675. Pundir, S. Amala, R., 2014, Evaluation area constant shape bi-weibull roc curve, Journal Modern Applied Statistical Methods, 13(1),1-20. Youden, W. J., 1950, Index rating diagnostic tests, Cancer, 3(1), 32-35.

what: Receiver Operating Characteristic for Power Lindley Distribution — PLindleyROC
title: Receiver Operating Characteristic for Power Lindley Distribution — PLindleyROC
text: Receiver operating characteristic (ROC) analysis carried Power Lindley distribution. Specificity, sensitivity, area curve, ROC curve evaluated.

title: Receiver Operating Characteristic for Power Lindley Distribution — PLindleyROC
code: dPLD(x, alpha, beta)  pPLD(x, alpha, beta)  qPLD(p, alpha, beta)  rPLD(n, alpha, beta)  plAUC(alpha1, beta1, alpha2, beta2)  plJ(alpha1, beta1, alpha2, beta2, init = 0)  plER(alpha1, beta1, alpha2, beta2, init = 0)  plCZ(alpha1, beta1, alpha2, beta2, init = 0)  plIU(alpha1, beta1, alpha2, beta2, init = 0)  plNI(alpha1, beta1, alpha2, beta2, init = 0)  plROC(x, y, alpha1, beta1, alpha2, beta2, empirical = TRUE)  prfROC(ctp = 0, alpha1, beta1, alpha2, beta2)

title: Receiver Operating Characteristic for Power Lindley Distribution — PLindleyROC
text: x, y vector quantiles. alpha shape parameter. beta scale parameter. p vector probabilities. n number observations. length(n) > 1, length taken number required. alpha1 shape parameter first sample. beta1 scale parameter first sample. alpha2 shape parameter second sample. beta2 scale parameter second sample. init initial value optimization calculation. empirical empirical must TRUE FALSE. ctp cut-point value.

title: Receiver Operating Characteristic for Power Lindley Distribution — PLindleyROC
text: dPLD gives probability density function Power Lindley Distribution. pPLD gives cumulative density function Power Lindley Distribution. qPLD gives quantile function Power Lindley Distribution. rPLD gives random numbers Power Lindley Distribution. plAUC gives area curve Power Lindley Distribution. Area ROC curve obtained. plJ gives Youden's index Power Lindley Distribution. Youden's J statistics way summarising performance diagnostic test. plER gives Closest (0,1) Criteria (ER) Power Lindley Distribution. Closest (0,1) Criteria (ER) way summarising performance diagnostic test. plCZ gives Concordance Probability Method Power Lindley Distribution. Concordance Probability Method way summarising performance diagnostic test. plIU gives Index Union  Power Lindley Distribution. Index Union way summarising performance diagnostic test. plNI gives New Index Power Lindley Distribution. plROC gives ROC graph Power Lindley Distribution. ROC graph given 1-specificity versus sensitivity. prfROC gives sensitivity,specificity 1-specificity Power Lindley Distribution.

title: Receiver Operating Characteristic for Power Lindley Distribution — PLindleyROC
text: probability density function (PDF) cumulative distribution function (CDF) follows: $$f\left( x\right) =\frac{\alpha \beta ^{2}}{\beta +1}\left( 1+x^{\alpha} \right) x^{\alpha -1}\exp \left( -\beta x^{\alpha }\right)$$ $$=zg_{1}\left( t\right) +\left( 1-z\right) g_{2}\left( t\right)$$ $$F\left( x\right) =P\left( X\leq x\right) =1-\left( 1+zx^{\alpha } \right) \exp \left( -\beta x^{\alpha }\right)$$ quantile function given , $$Q\left( u\right) =F^{-1}\left( u\right) =\left\{ -\frac{W\left( \left( 1+\beta \right) \left( -1+u\right) \exp \left( -\left( 1+\beta \right)                                               \right) \right) +1+\beta }                                        {\beta }\right\} ^{\frac{1}{\alpha }}$$ ,$$z =\frac{\beta }{\beta +1}$$ $$g_{1}\left( x\right)  =\alpha \beta x^{\alpha -1}\exp \left( -\beta x^{\alpha }\right)$$ $$g_{2}\left( x\right)  =\alpha \beta ^{2}x^{2\alpha -1}\exp \left(-\beta x^{\alpha }\right)$$ \(\alpha>0\) shape parameter, \(\beta>0\) scale parameter, \(0<u<1\) \(W\) Lambert W function. Let \(c\) cut-point, \(X_{1}\sim PL\left( \alpha_{1}, \beta_{1}\right) \) \(X_{2}\sim PL\left( \alpha_{2},\beta_{2}\right) \) \(\alpha_{2}>\alpha_{1}\). \(F_{1}\) \(F_{2}\) cumulative distribution functions related \(X_{1}\) \(X_{2}\), respectively. case, 1-specificity (False Positive Rate,FPR) sensitivity (True Positive Rate,TPR) given , $$FPR =P\left( X_{1}>c\right) =1-P\left( X_{1}\leq c\right) =1-F_{1} \left(c\right)$$ $$TPR =1-F_{2}\left( Q_{1}\left( 1-FPR\right) \right)$$ Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) curve can expressed follows: $$ROC =\left\{\left(r,( 1-F_{2}\left( Q_{1}\left( 1-r; \boldsymbol{\theta }\right) \right), r\\left( 0,1\right) \right)\right\}$$, \(\boldsymbol{\theta }=\left( \alpha _{1},\alpha _{2}, \beta _{1},\beta_{2}\right)\). Performance assesments ROC analysis follows: $$AUC =\int\limits_{0}^{1}ROCdr$$ $$J\left( c\right)  =\underset{c}{\arg \max } \left\{ \left( 1-F_{2}\left( c\right) \right) +F_{1}\left( c\right) -1\right\}$$ $$ER\left( c\right)  = \underset{c}{\arg \min }  \left\{ \sqrt{\left( 1-F_{1}\left( c\right) \right) ^{2}+\left( F_{2}\left( c\right) \right) ^{2}} \right\}$$ $$CZ\left( c\right)  = \underset{c}{\arg \max } \left\{ \left( 1-F_{2}\left( c\right) \right) \times F_{1}\left( c\right)  \right\}$$ $$IU\left( c\right)  =\left\{ \left\vert \left( 1-F_{2}\left( c\right) -AUC\right) \right\vert +\left\vert F_{1}\left( c\right) -AUC\right\vert \right\}$$ $$NI\left( c\right)  =\underset{c}{\arg \max }\left\{ \left( \left( 1-F_{1}\left( c\right) \right) \times F_{2}\left( c\right) \times F_{1}\left( c\right) \times \left( 1-F_{2}\left( c\right) \right) \right) \right.   \nonumber \\ \left. +\left( F_{1}\left( c\right) \times F_{2}\left( c\right) \times                 \left( 1-F_{1}\left( c\right) \right) \times                 \left( 1-F_{2}\left( c\right)                                                    \right) \right) \right\}$$ ,AUC area ROC curve, J Youden's J index, ER closest \(\left( 0,1\right)\) criteria, CZ concordance probability method, IU index Union NI new index.

title: Receiver Operating Characteristic for Power Lindley Distribution — PLindleyROC
text: Attwood, K., Hou, S., Hutson, ., 2022, Application skew exponential power distribution ROC curves, Journal Applied Statistics, 1-16. Ghitany M., Al-Mutairi D. K., Balakrishnan N., Al-Enezi L., 2013, Power lindley distribution associated inference, Computational Statistics & Data Analysis, 64,20–33. Liu, X., 2012, Classification accuracy cut point selection, Statistics medicine, 31(23), 2676-2686. Nahm, F. S., 2022, Receiver operating characteristic curve: overview practical use clinicians, Korean journal anesthesiology, 75(1), 25-36. Perkins, N. J., Schisterman, E. F., 2006, inconsistency “optimal” cutpoints obtained using two criteria based receiver operating characteristic curve, American journal epidemiology, 163(7), 670-675. Pundir, S. Amala, R., 2014, Evaluation area constant shape bi-weibull roc curve, Journal Modern Applied Statistical Methods, 13(1),1-20. Youden, W. J., 1950, Index rating diagnostic tests, Cancer, 3(1), 32-35.

title: Receiver Operating Characteristic for Power Lindley Distribution — PLindleyROC
code: dPLD(c(1,2,3,4,5,200),alpha=3,beta=2) #> [1]  1.082682e+00  1.620507e-05  3.560890e-21  1.070039e-52 3.363180e-105 #> [6]  0.000000e+00 pPLD(c(.5,1,2,3,4),alpha=3,beta=2) #> [1] 0.1562992 0.7744412 0.9999993 1.0000000 1.0000000 qPLD(c(.9971,0.5,0.3),alpha=3,beta=2) #> [1] 1.5220612 0.7868721 0.6362570 rPLD(10,alpha=3,beta=2) #>  [1] 0.8660076 0.6430432 0.9174384 0.7783524 1.0848489 0.4895074 1.1633065 #>  [8] 0.6533665 0.3399175 0.7319713 plAUC(alpha1=2,beta1=5,alpha2=6,beta2=1) #> [1] 0.9688111 plJ(alpha1=2,beta1=5,alpha2=6,beta2=1,init=0) #> $par #> [1] 0.7345928 #>  #> $value #> [1] -0.8241212 #>  #> $counts #> function gradient  #>       16       16  #>  #> $convergence #> [1] 0 #>  #> $message #> [1] "CONVERGENCE: REL_REDUCTION_OF_F <= FACTR*EPSMCH" #>  plER(alpha1=2,beta1=5,alpha2=6,beta2=1,init=0) #> $par #> [1] 0.7430008 #>  #> $value #> [1] 0.1247003 #>  #> $counts #> function gradient  #>       11       11  #>  #> $convergence #> [1] 0 #>  #> $message #> [1] "CONVERGENCE: REL_REDUCTION_OF_F <= FACTR*EPSMCH" #>  plCZ(alpha1=2,beta1=5,alpha2=6,beta2=1,init=0) #> $par #> [1] 0.736217 #>  #> $value #> [1] -0.831771 #>  #> $counts #> function gradient  #>       17       17  #>  #> $convergence #> [1] 0 #>  #> $message #> [1] "CONVERGENCE: REL_REDUCTION_OF_F <= FACTR*EPSMCH" #>  #plIU(alpha1=2,beta1=5,alpha2=6,beta2=1,init=0) #plNI(alpha1=2,beta1=5,alpha2=6,beta2=1,init=0.5) #x=c(1,2,3,4) #y=c(2,3,4) #plROC(x,y,alpha1=2,beta1=5,alpha2=6,beta2=1,empirical=F) prfROC(ctp=0.5,alpha1=2,beta1=5,alpha2=6,beta2=1) #>  Sensitivitiy   Specificity 1-Specificity  #>     0.9921878     0.6538067     0.3461933
